channel.title: elizaOS Daily Intelligence
channel.description: Daily facts and insights from the elizaOS ecosystem

item.title: elizaOS Intelligence: 2025-12-25
item.description:
Summary: Discussion centered on the AI16Z‚ÜíElizaOS token migration, ongoing price decline, and exchange-support risk, while the team continued positioning Eliza Cloud as the primary near-term tokenomics/value-accrual mechanism. Development and roadmap work continued in parallel, including Cloud beta onboarding and upcoming mainnet milestones.

GitHub Activity:

  • Snapshot Eligibility Issue + Tangem Wallet Connection Not Supported (Discord Support Compromised) (open)
  • Eliza Cloud Integration, add MCP + A2A service starter, integrate CLI and starter projects tight (open)
  • feat(auth): implement JWT authentication and user management (open)

Community Highlights:

  • #üí¨-discussion: Conversation focused on migration eligibility (Nov 11 snapshot wallet requirement), token mintability for Chainlink CCIP, migration rationale (moving off token2022 for exchange compatibility), token u...
  • #ü•á-partners: Participants compared ElizaOS FDV (~$22M) to competitors (Pippin, Virtuals), discussed communication expectations, and reiterated that Cloud rollout is tied to implementing tokenomics....
  • #core-devs: Shaw proposed splitting Babylon into points and non-points components, with the points game using Eliza Cloud for inference/authentication and a stated target of migrating 350,000 users; discussion al...

item.title: elizaOS Intelligence: 2025-12-24
item.description:
Summary: Discussion centered on ElizaOS token value accrual and how Eliza Cloud revenue will be used, alongside near-term Cloud feature clarifications (upload limits, planned custom model hosting). Development updates emphasized documentation cleanup, plugin work (including Starknet), and CI reliability issues tied to Claude billing.

GitHub Activity:

  • Monorepo documentation needs fixing (open)
  • Problems with spacing in numbered items (open)
  • Conversation duplication bug (open)
  • Opening agent chat should show most recent conversation (open)

Community Highlights:

  • #üí¨-discussion: Conversation focused on tokenomics and value accrual; team clarified that Eliza Cloud revenue (not yield) will be used for token buybacks, with further token utility planned for the Jeju release. Migr...
  • #üí¨-coders: Developer-focused discussion included plugin-starknet updates and guidance on building knowledge-backed agents in ElizaOS Cloud, including a 50MB upload limit, Markdown preference, and planned custom ...
  • #ü•á-partners: Debate on tokenomics compared ElizaOS to Virtual‚Äôs pairing model; team response emphasized token value tied to product usage and infrastructure development. Unusual sell patterns were discussed with s...

item.title: elizaOS Intelligence: 2025-12-23
item.description:
Summary: Eliza Cloud entered beta with ecosystem builders being onboarded ahead of a planned January ramp-up, while the team prepared for an 8004 mainnet milestone in mid-January and an agent onboarding push before EthDenver. In parallel, Discord discussions continued to center on ELIZAOS token utility/price concerns and near-term technical cleanup (plugin message standardization, analytics, and plugin fixes).

GitHub Activity:

  • A proposal to add a feedback button to the application. (open)
  • Implementation of chat renaming functionality. (open)
  • Addressing streaming and state management in the application. (open)
  • A request to update the Brandkit on GitHub. (open)
  • Improves message service handlers to perform asynchronous operations and optimizes them for cloud platforms. (open)

Community Highlights:

  • #ü•á-partners: Eliza Cloud was announced as entering beta with ecosystem builders being onboarded for production feedback; a January ramp-up plan (PR, launch event, coding influencers) and a mid-January 8004 mainnet...
  • #core-devs: Core dev status updates included: a fix for streaming issues in cloud build mode, Discord plugin fixes, ongoing work on EPIC 5 items, a pending PR to standardize Elizaos.handleMessage across plugins, ...
  • #üí¨-discussion: Brief discussion mentioned a community project (GAMEBORO, an AI gaming assistant on Steam) and shared metrics for elizaos and degenai....

item.title: elizaOS Intelligence: 2025-12-22
item.description:
Summary: Community discussion centered on ELIZAOS token utility/price concerns alongside imminent product delivery, with the team emphasizing the near-term launch of Eliza Cloud and planned buybacks/airdrops. Technical threads focused on a Starknet plugin deployment error, interoperability strategy proposals, and a surfaced high-severity n8n RCE vulnerability reference.

GitHub Activity:

  • Create Agent Button should be same in My Agents and Dashboard (open)
  • Move avatar button to #4 in agent builder (open)
  • Add Topics/Adjectives to form (open)
  • Inline send message button (open)
  • Tooltip for system prompt (open)

  • #üí¨-discussion: Token utility and price decline dominated, alongside repeated explanations that Eliza Cloud is near launch and that Cloud revenue will fund buybacks; ecosystem projects Babylon and Otako were cited as...
  • #üí¨-coders: A Starknet plugin 'unruggable' deployment flow failed with a String-to-BigInt parsing error; Odilitime requested the modified unruggable.ts for debugging. The suspended main X account and alternate ac...
  • #ü•á-partners: A brief market-structure note stated there are more sellers than buyers and referenced weak AI-crypto sector performance as context for price action....

item.title: elizaOS Intelligence: 2025-12-20
item.description:
Summary: Community discussion centered on token price performance and ongoing ai16z‚ÜíelizaOS migration constraints, while the team prepared to ship an ElizaOS Cloud MVP with streaming capabilities. Parallel GitHub work emphasized stability (migrations, security fixes), streaming foundations, plugin ecosystem expansion, and UX/onboarding planning.

GitHub Activity:

  • fix(plugin-sql): optimize pre-1.6.5 migration, RLS handling and SQL organisation (merged)
  • fix: encryption for character secrets in correct order (merged)
  • feat: Add ElizaOS Cloud as Default AI Provider in CLI (merged)
  • Add self-hosted Farcaster plugin to registry (merged)
  • Implement unified messaging API (plugin-telegram) (open)

Community Highlights:

  • #elizaos: Discussion included concerns about elizaOS token price behavior, confusion about ai16z‚ÜíelizaOS migration (including eligibility constraints), confirmation of a signed X (Twitter) deal, and product upd...
  • #elizaos: Migration deadline details (Feb 4, 2026) were reiterated, with clarification that ai16z is tradable but has no utility and elizaOS is the supported path. Technical coordination for cloud streaming was...

item.title: elizaOS Intelligence: 2025-12-20
item.description:
Summary: Community focus centered on ElizaOS token price weakness and ongoing AI16Z‚ÜíELIZAOS migration confusion, alongside heightened scam/impersonation risk. The team signaled near-term product momentum (Cloud MVP shipping Monday, v1.7.0 streaming release) and a business milestone (deal signed with X), with promises of token utility and buybacks plus a Q1/Q2 2026 roadmap.

GitHub Activity:

  • The SQL plugin was enhanced to ensure smooth data migration for users updating from older versions (merged)
  • A test failure in the CLI was resolved to improve reliability of the development environment (merged)
  • UI improvements to make plugin selection more intuitive (toggle selection / visual feedback) (closed)
  • UI improvements to make plugin selection more intuitive (toggle selection / visual feedback) (closed)
  • Redesigned dashboard planning (open)

Community Highlights:

  • #üí¨-coders: Only a single post sharing the v1.7.0 GitHub release link; no discussion....

item.title: elizaOS Intelligence: 2025-12-19
item.description:
Summary: Primary themes were continued community friction around the AI16Z‚ÜíelizaOS token migration (deadline set for 2026-02-04) and a near-term engineering push to ship cloud streaming, alongside ongoing work on EVM/onchain capabilities and ecosystem analytics.

item.title: elizaOS Intelligence: 2025-12-18
item.description:
Summary: Engineering effort centered on improving agent messaging/streaming and provider performance (parallelization + timeouts), while ecosystem work highlighted Starknet plugin integration breakages. Community discourse was dominated by token migration/exchange confusion and negative sentiment over price/perceived delivery gaps, alongside a notable Hyperfy v0.16.0 release announcement.

GitHub Activity:

  • feat: enhance streaming support in text generation (merged)
  • refactor(default-message-service): optimize provider handling in MultiStep (open)
  • fix: bootstrap action/provide format change fix + initPromise fix (open)
  • remove reassign runtime.db to individual connection (open)
  • Docs (open)

Community Highlights:

  • #üí¨-discussion: Conversation was dominated by negative community sentiment: complaints about token price decline, perceived lack of product delivery, and a contentious AI16Z‚ÜíELIZAOS migration described as confusing/d...
  • #üí¨-coders: Starknet plugin integration troubleshooting: questions on correct plugin installation approach, widespread TypeScript type mismatches (AgentRuntime vs IAgentRuntime) across action files, and a runtime...
  • #core-devs: Core discussion centered on provider performance architecture: PR #6263 proposes parallel provider execution with configurable timeout (default 1s) and warnings for slow providers, with debate on enfo...

item.title: elizaOS Intelligence: 2025-12-17
item.description:
Summary: Primary themes were continued friction and confusion around the AI16Z‚ÜíELIZAOS migration (especially exchange-specific handling and Korean community concerns), alongside ongoing core product work (streaming, plugin actions) and process pressure to merge an oversized Discord plugin PR. GitHub signals strong near-term prioritization of UI/UX simplification (terminology cleanups, edit-mode behavior fixes) and platform stability work.

item.title: elizaOS Intelligence: 2025-12-15
item.description:
Summary: Community attention centered on AI16Z‚ÜíElizaOS token migration friction (notably Bithumb delays) and an urgent, unverified claim that the migration site was compromised and used to drain tokens. In parallel, engineering discussions emphasized cloud-platform rollout and quality/stability improvements (SQL fixes, auth foundations, and tighter PR validation expectations).

item.title: elizaOS Intelligence: 2025-12-14
item.description:
Summary: elizaOS discussions centered on accelerating Eliza Cloud toward a full create‚Üípublish‚Üímonetize‚Üípromote loop (with SEO, ads, and social publishing integrations) while users surfaced practical friction around token migration via hardware wallets and plugin/config errors. GitHub activity (month-to-date) indicates heavy platform hardening plus major platform-enabling workstreams (cloud integration, unified API, and JWT-based multi-tenant auth).

GitHub Activity:

  • Eliza Cloud Integration, add MCP + A2A service starter, integrate CLI and starter projects tight (open)
  • feat(auth): implement JWT authentication and user management (open)
  • feat: Unified API - serverless - nodejs (open)
  • Shaw/chore/deslop (merged)
  • .eliza needed or plugin-sql crashes, should autocreate (closed)

Community Highlights:

  • #ü•á-partners: Shaw reported Eliza Cloud is progressing toward rapid building of agents/apps/n8n workflows and MCP/A2A services, explicitly implementing a business loop (create‚Üípublish‚Üímonetize‚Üípromote) with new SEO...
  • #üí¨-discussion: Users discussed migrating Ai16z tokens to ElizaOS using Ledger hardware wallets; a recurring issue is holdings not appearing when connecting Ledger directly. Community guidance recommends connecting L...
  • #üí¨-coders: A prior-day support thread indicates users encountered TEXT_LARGE errors even with minimal input; the likely cause was missing inference plugin registration (e.g., OpenAI), with outdated packages impl...

item.title: elizaOS Intelligence: 2025-12-13
item.description:
Summary: Community focus split between immediate developer UX issues (missing AI plugin causing TEXT_LARGE errors; plugin install failures likely due to outdated packages) and broader ecosystem concerns (token migration issues on Bithumb and price anxiety) alongside ongoing platform hardening and major feature work (Cloud integration, TypeScript/build stabilization, JWT auth/multi-tenant direction).

  • Eliza Cloud Integration, add MCP + A2A service starter, integrate CLI and starter projects tight (open)
  • fix: resolve TypeScript build errors in every packages - first step (open)
  • feat(auth): implement JWT authentication and user management (open)

  • fix(plugin-sql): migrate to messageService API and auto-create PGLite directories (open)

  • #üí¨-coders: A user reported TEXT_LARGE errors even for short prompts; root cause was identified as missing AI inference plugin registration (e.g., OpenAI). Follow-on OpenAI plugin install failures were attributed...

  • #ü•á-partners: A brief mention of 'Business Eliza' suggests partner interest in a business-focused Eliza variant, but without implementation detail....

item.title: elizaOS Intelligence: 2025-12-11
item.description:
Summary: A critical security vulnerability was discovered in elizaOS allowing attackers to extract secrets via API endpoints, while ongoing plugin issues with SQL and Twitter components continue to affect users.

GitHub Activity:

  • Eliza Cloud Integration, add MCP + A2A service starter, integrate CLI and starter projects tight (open)
  • fix(plugin-sql): optimize pre-1.6.5 migration, RLS handling and SQL organisation (open)
  • Shaw/chore/deslop (merged)
  • feat(auth): implement JWT authentication and user management (open)

Community Highlights:

  • #core-devs: A critical security vulnerability was discovered where server doesn't require ELIZA_SERVER_AUTH_TOKEN, allowing attackers to extract secrets via API endpoints. The issue stems from process.env being d...
  • #üí¨-coders: Multiple users reported foreign key constraint errors with plugin-sql and plugin-twitter components when creating memories. Stan is working on a fix and migration guide. Users also discussed API optio...
  • #ü•á-partners: Discussion focused on Polymarket's marketing strategy using a 50 Cent song, targeting sports bettors and users who might identify with government scrutiny....
